result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela Jeanette Scott

records.addlTxt:
4:38 PM Defendant Angela Jeanette Scott appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Jack Alan Umpleby appeared by phone for Angela Jeanette Scott.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing questionnaire & waiver filed. Probable Cause Found, Defendant bound over.
Information filed/reading waived, Not guilty plea entered all Counts. 
Atty Umpleby notes further older cases and requests this case to be scheduled in Branch 1.
Court schedules this case in Branch 1.
Atty Umpleby notes that Deft is a diabetic and requesting that Court contact the Jail staff due to Deft not receiving insulin since she has been in custody and also not receiving all of her medications.
Court notes that Judges have no authority and it is handled by the Sheriff's Dept - encourages Atty Umpleby to contact Sheriff's Dept nursing staff.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.

4:17 PM Defendant Angela Jeanette Scott not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jack Alan Umpleby appeared by phone for Angela Jeanette Scott.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Leave on for Prelim and bond was already addressed in Branch 1 last week.
